basic_info.description: I am Jonathan Brock and I'm a Software Engineer. I started out my adult life at the age of 17 entering the Army. I've spent years studying in-depth poker strategy and running simulations to determine statistically correct plays. I've always had a keen interest in automation as humans can only do such much, but our code can do so much more. My eventual goal is to get into Machine Learning or Autonomous vehicles, but I'm currently seeking any opportunities to grow as a Software Engineer. My ideal work environment is one with different teams working with different technologies, so that I can fuel my desire for learning. In the Army, I did a lot of troubleshooting both hardware and software for various systems. I always assumed everyone had good troubleshooting skills, but recently have discovered that I am a huge asset even working with code I don't know well as I am able to find solutions quickly and efficiently. Through poker, I've learned when to take risks, I've learned to read people and I've learned to track patterns.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
